title: Interactive Video-Based Social Problem-Solving Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills and general understanding of social phenomena
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment combining flipped learning and MOOCs; learners analyze social issue cases through pre-produced interactive videos and derive solutions via project-based activities

learning_goals: Learners can analyze core causes of social issues with 80% or higher accuracy using quizzes, discussion points, and choice scenarios provided in interactive videos.
Based on knowledge acquired through flipped learning, learners can specify and present solutions to local community problems in PBL team projects (4 members per team).
Through peer and self-assessment on MOOC platforms, learners can diagnose their learning achievements using a three-tier scale (basic/application/advanced).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
